text: We cannot remember too often that when we observe nature, and especially the ordering of nature, it is always ourselves alone we are observing.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

text: A good face they say, is a letter of recommendation. O Nature, Nature, why art thou so dishonest, as ever to send men with these false recommendations into the World!
author: Henry Fielding

text: What is called an acute knowledge of human nature is mostly nothing but the observer's own weaknesses reflected back from others.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

text: The Greeks possessed a knowledge of human nature we seem hardly able to attain to without passing through the strengthening hibernation of a new barbarism.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

text: It's just a part of our nature to hope.
author: Elizabeth Edwards
